def.dt: :a didactic book included in the Roman Catholic canon of the Old Testament and corresponding to the Wisdom of Solomon in the Protestant Apocrypha see bible table

entry.et: Middle English, from Old English wīsdōm, from wīs wise

def.dt: :ability to discern inner qualities and relationships :insight
:generally accepted belief challenges what has become accepted wisdom among many historians Robert Darnton
:a wise attitude, belief, or course of action
:the teachings of the ancient wise men
:a didactic book included in the Protestant Apocrypha see bible table

entry.et: from being cut usually in the late teens

def.dt: :the third molar that is the last tooth to erupt on each side of the upper and lower jaws in humans
:the generally accepted belief, opinion, judgment, or prediction about a particular matter
